title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) – The game plan was simple, yet utterly impossible to stop. Get the ball to Hakeem Olajuwon and get out of the way. On this night, the Philadelphia 76ers had no answer for the Dream.

In a masterclass of offensive dominance, Olajuwon poured in a staggering 49 points, single-handedly dismantling the Sixers in a 123-108 victory for the Houston Rockets. It was a historic, virtuoso performance that left defenders grasping at air and the Summit crowd in a state of rapturous disbelief.

From the opening tip, Olajuwon was uncontainable. He operated with a surgeon’s precision in the post, unleashing his famed "Dream Shake" with a ruthless efficiency. Every spin, every fadeaway, every powerful drop-step was executed to perfection. The stat line—49 points and 25 rebounds—reads like a video game glitch, a numerical testament to one man’s complete and total ownership of the painted area.

While the Sixers, led by a valiant 30-point effort from Jerry Stackhouse, tried to keep pace, they were merely witnesses to a force of nature. Every brief run Philadelphia mounted was extinguished by another Olajuwon bucket, a thunderous dunk, or a soft-touch jumper. He was the Rockets' offense, their defense, and their undeniable heartbeat.

When the final buzzer sounded, the only story was the one told by the scorebook. Forty-nine points. Twenty-five rebounds. One immortal performance from a legend at the absolute peak of his powers. Hakeem Olajuwon didn't just win a game; he authored a lasting monument to greatness.
